section_header: FOLLOW-UP METHOD
field_label:
High Risk Patient Navigation

The patient will be contacted by a patient navigator via phone to assist in follow-up of the findigns uncovered at the health fair.

General Patient Navigation

The patient should be assigned to an on-site patient navigator for follow-up of the findings uncovered at the health fair.

FDE Station Consultation

The patient should be consoled by the student volunteer and attending physician on the findings uncovered at the health fair.

**This patient has received a PAP SMEAR (CERVICAL CANCER) SCREENING. The results will be mailed to the patient directly within 2 weeks. If the results are positive, they will be contacted by a patient navigator. Please ensure patient information section has the correct information**

**This patient has received a SEPTIN-9 (COLORECTAL CANCER) SCREENING. The results will be mailed to the patient directly within 2 weeks. If the results are positive, they will be contacted by a patient navigator. Please ensure patient information section has the correct information**

**This patient has received a FIT (COLORECTAL CANCER) SCREENING. The results will be mailed to the patient directly within 2 weeks of sending their sample. If the results are positive, they will be contacted by a patient navigator. Please ensure patient information section has the correct information**

Is the patient interested in patient navigation?

Please read the following script to ensure interest:
"I see that you have some findings from the health fair that you need to follow up with. Like you heard at the beginning of the health fair at the "Initial Health Assessment Station," we have a program to help patients get follow up care. We can pair you with one of our volunteers and they will work with you through phone calls/text messages (whatever communication method you prefer) to help you figure out your insurance/payments options, make an appointment with a physician, and achieve your health care goals. Would you be interested in this service?"
Please confirm the patient's phone number: [phone_number]
select_choices_or_calculations: 1, Correct

field_label:
ELIGIBLE 
This patient IS eligible for the Jackson Card. The patient navigator should assist the patient in applying for a Jackson Card.

INELIGIBLE
This patient IS NOT eligible for the Jackson Card due to the following reason:
Patient HAS NOT lived in Miami-Dade County for a minimum of 90 days.

 

**NOTE: This patient will be eligible once the minimum residency requirement has been met. The patient navigator should assist the patient in gathering the appropriate documentation in preparation of applying for the Jackson Card once the minimum residency requirement is met. **

STEP 1 - GATHER DOCUMENTATION
The first step in applying for a Jackson Card is to gather appropriate documentation. These documents provide proof of the specific criteria outlined by the Jackson Card program and MUST be brought to the Financial Assessment appointment.
There are two (2) levels of documentation - core and supplemental. All patients are required to provide the core documentation while the necessary supplemental documentation is unique to each case. To find out the required supplemental documentation, we advise the patient to call the Jackson Health System Office of Financial Assistance. 
 
The core documents that need to be gathered prior and brought to the appointment include the following:
  1. Proof of Miami-Dade County Residency Documents
    • Florida Driver's License or Florida ID with Miami-Dade County address
      • AND
    • One (1) official document with patient's name and Miami-Dade County address dated greater than 90 days
      • AND
    • One (1) official document with the patient's name and address dated within 30 days
      • OR
    • Declaration of Domicile (if the patient does not have an official document listed in your name)
      • OR
    • Jackson Health System Third-Party support statement (if the patient is living with someone else and not obligated to pay rent)
  2. Proof of Citizenship, Identification & Immigration Status
    • Passport (from the patient's country of citizenship)
      • OR
    • Certificate of Naturalization
      • OR
    • Birth Certificate (from the patient's country of citizenship)
      • OR
    • Voter Registration Card
Was this patient counseled on the Jackson Card?

STEP 1 - INSURANCE MARKETPLACE DENIAL LETTER
The first step in applying for a Broward Card is to gather the appropriate documentation, one of which is a denial letter from one of the federal health insurance programs. The patient needs to provide proof that they do not qualify for Medicare, Medicaid, Florida KidCare or the Health Insurance Marketplace.
Please have the patient apply for one of the insurance programs listed above knowing that they will be denied.

 

**NOTE: If they do qualify for one of these programs, they will not qualify for the Broward Card.**

Please seek alternative resources for follow-up.

ELIGIBLE 
This patient IS eligible for the Light of the World Clinic. The patient navigator should assist the patient in applying for the Light of the World Clinic.

STEP 1 - GATHER DOCUMENTATION
The first step in applying for the Light of the World Clinic is to gather the appropriate documentation. These documents provide proof of the specific criteria outlined by the Light of the World program and are MUST be dropped off or mailed to the clinic with the respective application.

 

The required documents that need to be gathered prior and brought to the appointment include the following:
  1. COPIES of 2 forms of photo identification- ONE with your current address for each person applying
    • COPY of Birth Certificate and School ID for each minor child under 21 living at home
  2. Proof of domicile requirements: Please supply ONE of the following documents
    • COPY of current lease agreement/contract along with a copy of the last rent payment receipt
    • COPY of last paid mortgage statement
    • If you don't have a rental agreement or own a home - then you MUST submit a "Rent Verification Form" or an ORIGINAL notarized letter from Landlord with details of your current living arrangement:
      1. Monthly rental amount
      2. Complete address with city and zip code
      3. Are utilities included?
      4. Length or terms of living arrangement (monthly, yearly)
  3. Proof of Income requirements: Please supply any of the following documents that apply to your family situation
    • COPIES of the last 6 weeks consecutive paystubs for ALL adults in the family
    • If your employer pays you in cash you MUST submit an ORIGINAL notarized letter verifying employment
    • If you are self-employed, you MUST submit an ORIGINAL notarized letter stating your occupation and monthly income
    • If you don't work, you MUST still submit an ORIGINAL notarized letter stating that you have no income and explain why
  4. COPY of your CURRENT BILLS: FPL, Phone or other Utility Bill you have in your name
  5. COPY of your most recent tax return (ALL PAGES) including W2/1099 if you filed one
  6. COPY of ALL car registrations for the household in your name
Was the patient counseled on the Light of the World Clinic?

Criteria for high risk are as follows:
Systolic BP >= 160
Diastolic BP >=100
Glucose >= 200mg/dL
ASCVD risk score >= 20%
Ophthalmology: "Glaucoma consultation" and "Ophthalmic consultation" are high risk; findings suggestive of risk requiring prompt follow up per the physician's recommendation
Dermatology: Lesions suspicious for malignancy or similar risk per the physician's recommendation
Male Exam: Lesions suspicious for malignancy or similar risk per the physician's recommendation
Female Exam: Positive pregnancy/needs prenatal care, breast mass felt on exam, high suspicion for infection, any other abnormality on pelvic exam (abnormal bleeding, abnormal Pap)
Bone Density: Postmenopausal woman with a T-score less than -2.5
Fail any objective test performed by PT AND (history of two falls OR a history of 1 fall with an injury)
Mental Health:,Any failed test or positive screen (though not all positive screens will be high risk - this is based on physician's discretion) or similar risk per the, physician's recommendation
Positive HIV
Positive Hep C
Positive FIT or Sept9
Concerning finding at ENT/Dental
BMI >40
